metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23219 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.Description:
The deprecated compatibility function clnt_create in the sunrpc module ofthe GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.34 copies its hostname argument onthe stack without validating its length, which may result in a bufferoverflow, potentially resulting in a denial of service or (if anapplication is not built with a stack protector enabled) arbitrary codeexecution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-prof - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.35-0ubuntu1
locales - 2.35-0ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.35-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.35-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.35-0ubuntu1').
